title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9 - 8 - 7 - 6 - 5 Stronger Essays

Essays in this category will illustrate the following qualities in varying degrees of effectiveness:

Standards

  • has a clear well developed thesis

  • well organized

  • addresses the terms of the question: tasks, content, chronology — perhaps with some unevenness

  • supports the thesis with specific evidence

  • even a "9" need not be flawless

Indicators: 9 – 8

  1. Gives accurate definitions or descriptions for Enlightenment assumptions of human behavior and the role of reason. (behavior and reason may be conflated)

  2. Develops the ideas of Darwin and Freud that are relevant.

  3. Demonstrates explicitly how these ideas challenge those of the Enlightenment.

Indicators: 7 – 6

  1. Definitions or descriptions of Enlightenment, assumptions of human behavior and reason

  2. less well-developed or somewhat more implicit.

  3. Ideas of Darwin and Freud relevant but may have less clarity.

  4. Challenges to Enlightened views may be less clear or only implicit.

5 – 4: Mixed Essays


Standards

  • Contains a thesis, perhaps superficial or simplistic

  • Responds to the terms of the question unevenly: tasks, evidence, chronology

  • May contain errors, factual and/or interpretive

Indicators:

  1. Definitions or descriptions of Enlightenment assumptions of human behavior and role of reason are often simplistic, limited, or vague.

  2. Ideas of Darwin and Freud are less relevant or more weakly demonstrated.

  3. Unbalanced, (e.g. may be stronger on Darwin or Freud).

  4. Minimal linkage.

3 – 2 – 1 – 0: Weaker Essays

Essays in the category will demonstrate the following qualities to varying degrees. Essays scored "0" or "1" may attempt to answer the question bur fail to do so.


Standards:

  • Thesis confused, unfocused, or absent, or simply restates the question.

  • Misconstrues the question, or omits major tasks

  • May contain major errors

Indicators:

  1. Definitions or descriptions of Enlightenment assumptions of human behavior and the role of reason are often limited, erroneous, or missing.

  2. Ideas of Darwin and Freud are poorly stated, undeveloped and may not be linked to the Enlightenment.

  3. References to Darwin and Freud are irrelevant to the question
